sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"景色，风景"之意。
means: scene ： 指具体的、局部的或一时的景色，可以是自然形成的，也可人工造成的。
view ： 普通和词，多指从远处或高处所见的景色。
sight ： 侧重指旅游观光的风光，包括城市景色或自然风光景色。也指人造景物或奇特的景色。
scenery ： 指一个国家或某一地区的整体自然风景。
landscape ： 多指在内陆的自然风光。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"视力，视觉"之意。
means: vision ： 书面用词，含义广泛，指人的视力或视野，也可指远见卓识。
eyesight ： 普通用词，指眼睛的正常功能。
sight ： 普通用词，与eyesight同义，可换用，指由实实在在的事物引起的视觉。
perception ： 指视觉，也可泛指其它器官的功能，或引申指敏锐的理解力。

word_mean: 视力：视觉的作用或能力

sentence.Network_en: They observed the comet for 70 days before it faded from sight.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们观察了这颗彗星70天，直至其慢慢从视线中消失。

sentence.Network_en: A bright shooting star, or meteor, is an unforgettable sight.
sentence.Network_cn: 明亮的流星，或者说陨石，是番难忘的景象。

sentence.Network_en: We encountered the pathetic sight of a family packing up its home.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们目睹了一家人正在收拾家当准备离开的凄惨景象。

jx.jx_en_mean: on first seeing or meeting someone
glimpse for a moment; suddenly notice

lj.lj_ly: when she caught sight of him she smiled.
no other vehicle was in sight.

jx.jx_en_mean: so as to see or be seen from
jx.jx_cn_mean: 以便看到，以便能被…看见

lj.lj_ly: I climbed the hill and came in sight of the house.
lj.lj_ls: 我爬上山，看到了那座房子。

jx.jx_en_mean: visible, especially through the sights of one's gun
jx.jx_cn_mean: （尤指通过枪或炮的瞄准器）看得到的

jx.jx_en_mean: be no longer able to see

jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)难看的东西；不好的情况

jx.jx_en_mean: as soon as someone or something has been seen

lj.lj_ly: in Africa, paramilitary game wardens shoot poachers on sight.
lj.lj_ls: 在非洲，准军事狩猎管理员一见到偷猎者就开枪。

lj.lj_ly: she saw them off, waving until the car was out of sight.
lj.lj_ls: 她给他们送行，一直挥手到车子从目光中消失。

jx.jx_en_mean: (亦作 outasight)[often as exclamation](informal)extremely good; excellent

phrase.cizu_name: out of sight, out of mind

jx.jx_en_mean: (proverb)you soon forget people or things that are no longer visible or present
become more (or less) ambitious; increase (or lower) one's expectations
jx.jx_cn_mean: 越来越有（或没有）抱负；期望越来越高（或低）

jx.jx_en_mean: have as an ambition; hope strongly to achieve or reach
jx.jx_cn_mean: 把…定为奋斗目标；极其渴望获得（或达到）

lj.lj_ly: Katherine set her sights on university.
lj.lj_ls: 凯瑟琳极其渴望上大学。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)used to indicate that something is so described to a considerable extent

lj.lj_ly: the old lady is a sight cleverer than Sarah.
lj.lj_ls: 老太太要比萨拉机灵得多。

lj.lj_ly: he's a sight too full of himself.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English (ge)sihth 'something seen', of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch zicht and German Gesicht 'sight, face, appearance'. The verb dates from the mid 16th cent. (in sense 2)

encyclopedia.content: 电影 视界 导演： 亚当·阿哈尔布兰特 编剧： 亚当·阿哈尔布兰特 主演： 弗兰克·垂诺阿丽森·皮尔索德克莱顿·海斯克小托尼·卢克 上映： 2009年5月20日 类型： 恐怖片惊悚片 地区： 美国 语言： 英语内容简介 主人公杰夫里生活在自己构筑的否定的复杂世界中，他的身份是一个被恐惧笼罩的精神病人。其实他一直被复仇的恶灵所纠缠，因为他能看到其他人看不到的东西。在遇到达娜，一个可以分享他的特殊视觉能力的漂亮女人后，杰夫

entry.def: Someone's sight is their ability to see.

example.ex: My sight is failing, and I can't see to read any more...
example.tran: 我的视力在下降，看不了书了。

example.ex: I use the sense of sound much more than the sense of sight.
example.tran: 我用听觉比视觉要多得多。

entry.def: The sight of something is the act of seeing it or an occasion on which you see it.

example.ex: I faint at the sight of blood...
example.tran: 我一见到血就晕。

example.ex: The sight of him entering a room could flood her with desire.
example.tran: 见到他进入房间会让她心中欲望澎湃。

entry.def: A sight is something that you see.

example.ex: The practice of hanging clothes across the street is a common sight in many parts of the city...
example.tran: 街边晾晒衣服在这座城市的许多地区随处可见。

example.ex: We encountered the pathetic sight of a family packing up its home...
example.tran: 我们目睹了一家人正在收拾家当准备离开的凄惨景象。

entry.def: If you sight someone or something, you suddenly see them, often briefly.

example.ex: The security forces sighted a group of young men that had crossed the border...
example.tran: 安全部队突然看见一群越过边境的年轻人。

example.ex: A fleet of French ships was sighted in the North Sea.
example.tran: 在北海突然发现了一支法国船队。

entry.def: The sights of a weapon such as a rifle are the part which helps you aim it more accurately.
The sights are the places that are interesting to see and that are often visited by tourists.

example.ex: We'd toured the sights of Paris...
example.tran: 我们游览了巴黎的风景名胜。

example.ex: I am going to show you the sights of our wonderful city...
example.tran: 我会带你浏览我们这座美丽城市的风景名胜。

entry.def: You can use a sight to mean a lot. For example, if you say that something is a sight worse than it was before, you are emphasizing that it is much worse than it was.

example.ex: She's been no more difficult than most daughters and a sight better than some I could mention...
example.tran: 与大多数女儿相比，她并不算太难管，而且比我知道的一些要乖巧得多。

example.ex: We weren't doing anything different to what we've always done. We're just doing it a damn sight quicker.
example.tran: 我们正在做的事和我们一直在做的别无二致，只不过我们现在动作要快得多。

entry.def: If you catch sight of someone, you suddenly see them, often briefly.

example.ex: Then he caught sight of her small black velvet hat in the crowd...
example.tran: 然后他突然在人群中看见了她那顶小巧的黑色天鹅绒帽子。

example.ex: Every time I catch sight of myself in the mirror, I feel so disappointed.
example.tran: 每次我瞥见镜子里的自己就觉得沮丧。

entry.tran: 乍一看;一见之下;初看时
entry.def: If you say that something seems to have certain characteristics at first sight, you mean that it appears to have the features you describe when you first see it but later it is found to be different.

example.ex: It promised to be a more difficult undertaking than might appear at first sight...
example.tran: 那项任务可能比乍看之下还要困难。

example.ex: At first sight it resembles a traditional village of two-storeyed, balconied houses, set among well-tended gardens.
example.tran: 乍一看，它就像个传统的村庄：带阳台的两层楼房坐落于精心照料的花园中。

entry.def: If something is in sight or within sight, you can see it. If it is out of sight, you cannot see it.

example.ex: The sandy beach was in sight...
example.tran: 沙滩映入眼帘。

example.ex: The Atlantic coast is within sight of the hotel...
example.tran: 从宾馆可以看见大西洋海岸。

entry.tran: 在望;在即;临近;即将产生
entry.def: If a result or a decision is in sight or within sight, it is likely to happen within a short time.

example.ex: An agreement on many aspects of trade policy was in sight...
example.tran: 一项涉及到贸易政策诸多方面的协议即将达成。

example.ex: There is no end in sight to the struggle for power...
example.tran: 权力的争斗近期不会终止。

entry.def: If you lose sight of an important aspect of something, you no longer pay attention to it because you are worrying about less important things.

example.ex: In some cases, US industry has lost sight of customer needs in designing products...
example.tran: 某些情况下，美国工业在产品设计上忽略了客户的需求。

example.ex: We shouldn't lose sight of the fact that education is important for its own sake.
example.tran: 教育本身就很重要，我们不应忽视这一事实。

entry.def: If you know someone by sight, you can recognize them when you see them, although you have never met them and talked to them.

example.ex: I knew him by sight but had never spoken with him.
example.tran: 我和他有过几面之缘，但从未说过话。

entry.def: If you say 'out of sight, out of mind', you mean that people quickly forget someone if he or she goes away.

example.ex: The problems of the poor are largely invisible—out of sight, out of mind.
example.tran: 穷人的问题人们大多看不见——正所谓“眼不见，心不烦”。

entry.def: If someone is ordered to do something on sight, they have to do it without delay, as soon as a person or thing is seen.

example.ex: Troops shot anyone suspicious on sight...
example.tran: 部队士兵一见到任何可疑的人马上就开枪。

example.ex: Magee was set free but British authorities were asked to arrest him on sight.
example.tran: 马吉被释放了，但是英国当局却被要求一见到他就立即逮捕。

entry.tran: 不好看;不雅观;有碍观瞻
entry.def: If you say that someone or something is not a pretty sight, you mean that it is not pleasant to look at.

example.ex: The bathroom is not a pretty sight. The wallpaper's peeling, the tiles are crumbling.
example.tran: 浴室破旧不堪。墙纸剥落了，瓷砖也裂了。

entry.tran: 以…为奋斗目标;志在必得;决心做到
entry.def: If you set your sights on something, you decide that you want it and try hard to get it.

example.ex: They have set their sights on the world record...
example.tran: 他们的目标是冲击世界纪录。

example.ex: Although she came from a family of bankers, Franklin set her sights on a career in scientific research.
example.tran: 尽管出身于银行家家庭，富兰克林还是决心从事科研事业。

entry.tran: 在未见实物的情况下;事先未经检查
entry.def: If you agree to buy something sight unseen, you agree to buy it, even though you have not seen it and do not know what condition it is in.

example.ex: Although people sometimes buy property sight unseen, it's a remarkably bad idea.
example.tran: 尽管人们有时没看房就买了房，但这真是一个很糟糕的主意。

sentences.sentence: "the sight of his wife brought him back to reality"
"he was a familiar sight on the television"
"they went to Paris to see the sights"

means.word_mean: 3. the ability to see; the faculty of vision
4. a optical instrument for aiding the eye in aiming, as on a firearm or surveying instrument

sentences.sentence: "in his sight she could do no wrong"

means.word_mean: 7. the act of looking or seeing or observing;

sentences.sentence: "he tried to get a better view of it"
"his survey of the battlefield was limited"

means.word_mean: 8. (often followed by `of') a large number or amount or extent;

sentences.sentence: "he made a mint on the stock market"

means.word_mean: 1. catch sight of; to perceive with the eyes;

sentences.sentence: "he caught sight of the king's men coming over the ridge"

auth_sentence.content: Love at first sight has never sounded so good.
auth_sentence.res_content: Love at first sight has never sounded so good.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Love at first sight has never sounded so good.

auth_sentence.content: There's not a Neptunes' collaboration in sight.
auth_sentence.res_content: There's not a Neptunes' collaboration in sight.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There's not a Neptunes' collaboration in sight.

auth_sentence.content: There is a kind of out-of-sight, out-of-mind attitude.
auth_sentence.res_content: There is a kind of out-of-sight, out-of-mind attitude.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There is a kind of out-of-sight, out-of-mind attitude.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 富有洞察力的,有深刻见解的
stems_affixes.word_buile: insight[n.洞察力,见识]+ful有……的→adj.富有洞察力的,有深刻见解的
in进入+sight眼光；观察，看→眼光看进去→洞察力

stems_affixes.value_cn: 勘漏, 失察, 疏忽, 失败, 小心照顾
stems_affixes.word_buile: over在……之上,越过+sight眼光；观察，看→越过[漏洞]→没看到
sight眼光；观察，看→n.视力,视觉,见,视域,眼界
sight视力,视觉+see眼光；观察，看+ing状态→n.观光，游览

Sentence.sentence: To get alcohol out of drivers' immediate sight.
As American research universities begin to resemble profit centers and entertainment complexes, it's easy to lose sight of their primary mission; to produce and spread knowledge.
Monarch butterflies, the large origin black insects, are common summer sights in northern United States and Canada.
The curtains were never drawn, even at night, so guests got a view of the lake and fountains outside which were lit up at night – a very attractive sight.

sentences.en: He had his sight tested by a doctor.
sentences.cn: 他让医生给他检查了视力。

sentences.en: The sight of the garden bears back the days when we lived in Paris.
sentences.cn: 见到那个花园使我们回想起当年住在巴黎时的日子。

means.word_mean: 情景, 景象， 看见（或看得见）的事物

sentences.en: The view burst upon our sight.
sentences.cn: 那景象突然出现在我们眼前。

sentences.en: The sunset was a very beautiful sight.
The Great Wall is one of the sights of the world.
After five days at sea, we sighted land.
sentences.cn: 我们在海上航行了五天后见到了陆地。

sentences.en: Crewmen aboard the tanker sighted a ship in distress off the coast of Senegal.
sentences.cn: 油船上的船员们在塞内加尔的近海发现了一艘失事的船。

sentences.en: Sight along the edge to see if it's straight.
sentences.cn: 顺着边目测, 看看直不直。

jushi.english: The sight of the birds suggested the idea of flying machines.
jushi.chinese: 看见了鸟启发了制造飞行器的想法。

jushi.english: I can't bear the sight of it.
